Pecan Brittle Oatmeal Cookies
142g coarsely chopped pecans
150g granulated sugar
57g unsalted butter
0.5 tsp baking soda
0.5 tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt
227g unsalted butter, cut into tablespoons
173g all-purpose flour
6g Diamond Crystal kosher salt
6g baking soda
200g old-fashioned rolled oats
150g packed dark brown sugar
100g granulated sugar
2 large eggs, cold from the refrigerator (100g)
1 tbsp vanilla extract
    Pecan Brittle
  1. Toast the pecans in the oven until golden brown and smelling good.
  2. In a small saucepan, combine 150g granulated sugar, 57g unsalted butter, and a splash of water
  3. Cook until the caramel turns a deep amber color, and swirl the pan rater than stirring - which would cause crystallization.
  4. Remove from heat and quickly stir in the toasted pecans, baking soda, and salt.
  5. Spread the brittle in an even layer on a baking sheet and allow it to cool completely before chopping into small pieces.
    6. Cookie Dough
  6. Brown half of the butter over medium heat, stirring constantly until golden brown. Pour the browned butter over the remaining butter in the bowl of a stand mixer and allow it to cool.
  7. In a food processor, pulse together the flour, 6g salt, baking soda, half of the oats, and half of the chopped pecan brittle until the oats and brittle are finely ground.
  8. Add the granulated sugar and brown sugar to the cooled butter in the mixer. Mix until smooth but not fluffy.
  9. Add the cold eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Stir in the vanilla extract.
  10. Gradually add the flour mixture to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
  11. Stir in the remaining oats and the other half of the chopped pecan brittle by hand.
    12. Bake and Assemble
  12. Portion the dough into balls about 60g each.
  13. Chill the dough in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours.
  14. Preheat the oven to 175C and bake until the edges are golden brown but the centers remain soft. Mine took about 14 minutes
Notes
  • Next time try reducing the work by not blitzing the brittle, oats etc in the food processor.
Footer. Not much here really. Nice to have a footer though.
